name: Lou Handman
comments: Composer, who was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1975

name: Roy Turk
comments: Songwriter and lyricist. Inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1970

name: Wally Gold
comments: Singer, songwriter, record producer and music business executive.  After leaving the music business, Gold worked as a travel agent until his death.

name: Lincoln Chase
comments: Lincoln Chase was a successful songwriter in the 1950s and 1960s. He was less successful as a recording artist.

name: Pierre Delanoë
comments: Prolific songwriter and translator English / French

name: Carl Sigman
comments: Primarily a lyricist, Sigman also occasionally wrote melodies. Sigman had a six-decade-long career with work recorded by Count Basie, Benny Goodman, Nat King Cole, Billie Holiday, Louis Prima, Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, The Four Coins, Elvis Presley, Ray Charles, Brenda Lee, Sonny and Cher, Andy Williams, Sammy Davis Jr., Sarah Vaughan, Jerry Lee Lewis, Merle Haggard, Van Morrison and Joni Mitchell -- among others. He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1972.

name: Mort Shuman
comments: Songwriter, singer and pianist, who was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1992

name: Fred Wise
comments: Songwriter who wrote many of the songs Elvis Presley performed in films.

name: Ben Weisman
comments: Songwriter.  Weisman wrote or co-wrote 57 songs covered by Elvis Presley - the most of any songwriter.

name: Ray Henderson
comments: Tin Pan Alley composer and piano accompanist to Vaudeville song and dance acts. Inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1970 and in 2001, into the Buffalo Music Hall of Fame.

name: Mort Dixon
comments: Lyricist Inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1970

name: Andrew Lloyd Webber
comments: Musical theatre composer, who was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1995

name: Tim Rice
comments: Award-winning lyricist who was a prolific contributor into works for theater and movies from 1969 on. In 1999, he was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame.

name: Roger Taylor [GB1]
comments: Best known as the drummer, backing vocalist, and occasional lead vocalist for British rock band Queen.

name: Teenie Hodges
comments: Soul guitarist and songwriter. Was part of "Hi Rhythm", the celebrated house band at Hi Records in Memphis starting in the late 1960s.

name: Joe Strummer
comments: Punk rock rhythm guitarist, vocalist and songwriter

name: Richard Poindexter
comments: Pianist, singer, songwriter and producer of soul music

name: Bobby Poindexter
comments: Singer, songwriter and producer of soul music

name: Harry Warren
comments: Composer and lyricist.  Warren was the first major American songwriter to concentrate on writing for movies. Inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1971

name: Al Dubin
comments: Lyricist born in Switzerland to Russian Jewish parents.  The family came to the US when Dubin was 2 years old and he grew up in Philadelphia. He is best known for his collaborations with the composer Harry Warren. Known for his larger-than-life persona Dubin struggled with alcohol and drugs and fell on hard times in the 1940s. He died from an overdose of barbiturates. He was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1970.

name: Abrim Tilmon
comments: Soul, disco and gospel singer and songwriter

name: Johann Pachelbel
comments: Baroque composer, organist and teacher from Nuremberg

name: Dominique Aldridge
comments: Rap producer born and raised in south central Los Angeles.

name: Titus Turner
comments: R&B and blues singer and songwriter

name: Henry Glover
comments: Trumpet player, songwriter, arranger and record producer, one of the most influential recording executives of the 1950's, supervised blues, rhythm-and-blues and country recordings.

name: Sly Stone
comments: Soul, R&B, pop and funk music singer-songwriter and musician

name: Roland Orzabal
personal_name: Roland Jaime Orzabal de la Quintana

name: Nikki Sixx
comments: Heavy metal/glam rock bassist and songwriter.

name: Peter Baltes
comments: Hard rock and heavy metal musician

name: Bernard Besman
comments: Russian-born producer, label owner and songwriter, who often worked with John Lee Hooker on his early recordings

name: Jimmy Kennedy
comments: Jimmy Kennedy was a prolific popular songwriter, with an estimated 2000 songs in career spanning 50 Years. Born and raised in Northern Ireland, he moved to London where he established his long successful career. In the 1950s he resided in the United States, but returned to England.  In 1983, Kennedy was made an officer of the British Empire for his contributions to music, and he was posthumously inducted into the Songwriters Hall of fame in 1997.

name: Jean-Claude Vannier
comments: Self-taught pianist, composer, arranger, and producer, who has worked with so many of France’s all-time greats.

name: Reverend Gary Davis
comments: Blues and gospel singer, guitarist and songwriter who lost complete sight at young age

name: Hy Zaret
comments: Tin Pan Alley lyricist, composer and lawyer.

name: Leonard Nimoy
comments: Actor, film director, writer, musician and photographer. Nimoy is best known for playing the character of Mr. Spock on the television series "Star Trek".

name: Aidan Bartley
comments: Musician, composer and writer born in Belfast and brought up in the north of England. Now based in Berlin, Germany.

name: Johan de Leeuw
comments: Composer and trance producer also known as Armenian Sun

name: Phosphorescent
comments: Moniker of American singer-songwriter, Matthew Houck. Originally from Alabama, Houck began recording and performing under this "nom de plume" in 2001 in Athens, Georgia. He is currently based in Brooklyn, New York.

name: The Rose of Avalanche
comments: Alternative rock band from Leeds, which reformed in 2019

name: Stereo de Luxe
comments: Berlin based DJ and production duo known for their uniquely Germanic style of electro-lounge.

name: Vince Hill
comments: Traditional pop music singer and songwriter born in Coventry

name: The Blue Hearts
comments: Punk rock band active from 1985 to 1995.

name: The Impact of Brass
comments: South Florida group, who performed at the 'Crossways Airport Inn Lounge' in Miami as a home base. The members were all University of Miami music students when they met and formed the group.

name: Lisa Fischer
comments: Singer-songwriter best known for her work as a back-up singer. Fischer is featured in the documentary 20 Feet From Stardom.

name: Johnny Jones [US1]
aliases: Johnny Jones and The King Casuals

name: John Eddie
aliases: John Eddie & The Front Street Runners
John Eddie and The Front Street Runners

name: Hal Mooney
comments: Composer and arranger, best known for his extensive arrangement work with Mercury Records artists like Sarah Vaughan, Dinah Washington and Billy May, from the mid-1950s to the late 1960s.

name: David Ackles
comments: Singer-songwriter and child actor who appeared in the series of eight children's films with the principle character "Rusty" in the 1940s. For a time, Ackles was a staff writer at Elektra Records, but when none of the label's artists wanted to record his theatrical songs, he did it himself.

name: Sara Hickman
comments: Rock, folk, pop, children's music singer-songwriter based in Texas

name: Walter Roland
comments: Blues, boogie-woogie and jazz pianist, guitarist and singer

name: Francesco Paolo Tosti
comments: Italian, later British, composer and music teacher born in Ortona. In 1875 Tosti travelled to London and made several powerful friends who introduced him to the highest levels of English society. In 1880 he was made singing master to the Royal Family. His fame as a composer of songs grew rapidly while he was in England. There was an enormous demand for his compositions. By 1885 he was the most popular composer of songs in England. Tosti took British nationality and was knighted.

name: Jake Dawson
comments: Chicago-based blues guitarist and singer. Played among others with Albert King, Willie Kent and James Brown.

name: Lucky Millinder
comments: Rhythm and blues and swing bandleader. Although he could not read or write music, did not play an instrument and rarely sang, his showmanship and musical taste made his bands successful.

name: Madlyn Davis
aliases: Madlyn Davis and Her Hot Shots

name: Rosa Lee Hill
comments: Blues singer and guitarist, discovered by Alan Lomax

name: Precious Bryant
comments: Country blues, gospel, and folk singer and guitarist

name: Hot Lips Page
aliases: Hot Lips Page and His Orchestra
Hot Lips Page and The V-Disc All Stars
comments: Jazz trumpeter and blues vocalist from the swing-era

name: Die Larson-Boys
comments: Studio vocalists sometimes also appearing as "Die Larson Boys und Girls". Founded by Klaus Netzle a.k.a. Eric Larson.

name: Itaal Shur
comments: Composer, songwriter, producer and musician residing in New York

name: Sean Nelson
aliases: Sean Nelson And His Mortal Enemies

name: Sara Bareilles
comments: Indie pop singer-songwriter and pianist from Los Angeles. Bareilles also served as a judge on season 3 of the television show The Sing-Off, a competition for a cappella groups. Interestingly, she can be heard as part of "Awaken A Cappella" on Dysfunktional Family Album from 2003.

name: Sylvester Jordan Jr.
comments: Also known as Sly Pyper or Sly Jordan

name: j.Que
comments: R&B songwriter and producer from Alabama, part of the production group known as "The Clutch"

name: Brian Kennedy [US]
comments: R&B and hip-hop producer and songwriter from Kansas City, Missouri

name: The Nicholas Brothers
comments: Acrobatic dance duo of actual brothers Fayard and Harold.

name: Quigley
comments: Singer/songwriter from Manchester, one-half of the indie pop duo known as The Montgolfier Brothers

name: Gallous
comments: Catherine Navarro: Vocals Diane Nicolle: Piano Ian Ramsay: Guitar Christophe Vandewalle: Double Bass Sebastian Dewar: Drums

name: The Wheels [US]
comments: Doo-wop quartet consisting of Rudy Anderson (lead tenor), James Pender (tenor), Kenneth Fox (baritone), and Lorenzo Cook (bass).

name: The Interstellars
comments: Emo/psychedelic band from Charlotte, North Carolina.

name: David Lewis [US2]
comments: R&B and pop singer, guitarist, songwriter, arranger, and producer

name: Wayne Lewis [US2]
comments: R&B singer, keyboardist, songwriter/composer and producer

name: Eddie Ray
comments: Record company executive, producer, songwriter, and author.

name: Hank Mizell
comments: Rockabilly guitarist, singer and songwriter. Mizell gave up performing professionally to become a preacher.

name: Ralph Simonton
comments: Owner of a Chicago bar called the 'Napoleon Lounge', according to some accounts a "a low-life redneck bar", where the Hank Mizell combo secured a residency, playing there every night from Wednesday to Sunday. Singleton helped negotiate the national distribution deal for 'Jungle Rock' with the King label and in return was credited as co-writer ever since.

name: Johnny Tyler
aliases: Johnny Tyler and The Riders of the Rio Grande
Johnny Tyler and Riders of the Rio Grande

name: Ella Mae Morse
aliases: Ella Mae Morse and Her Boogie Woogie Four
Ella Mae Morse and Her Boogie Woogie Seven
comments: Popular singer who blended jazz, country, pop and R&B

name: Allan Roberts
comments: Composer, lyricist, arranger and performer from Brooklyn. Allan Roberts wrote several highly popular songs recorded by Ella Fitzgerald, The Ink Spots, the Andrews Sisters, Bing Crosby, and other top recording artists.

name: Sidney Prosen
comments: Songwriter, record company owner, producer and manager. He formed Village Music which published his big hit, "Till I Waltz Again with You." He "discovered" Simon and Garfunkel. signed them to his "Big" label and managed them at the beginning of their careers.

name: Jimmy Isle
comments: Rock 'n' roll singer, active at the end of the 1950s and the first half of the 1960s, and songwriter

name: Ronnie Isle
comments: Rock 'n' roll singer, active at the end of the 1950s and early 1960s. Died in a car crash.

name: Fred Koury
comments: Syrian-born night club owner (the "Plantation Supper Club" in Greensboro, North Carolina). manager of Bill Craddock and songwriter.

name: Sal Mineo
comments: Stage and screen actor, who also enjoyed a brief but very successful stint as a rock 'n roll singer during the second half of the 1950s

name: Otis Williams
aliases: Otis Williams and His New Group
Otis Williams and The Midnight Cowboys

name: Kenny Dino
comments: Rock 'n' roll and pop music singer-songwriter

name: Gordon Campbell
comments: Scottish singer-songwriter and director of Streamline Music Ltd.

name: Raquel Rastenni
comments: Singer, who was born in Copenhagen. Her Jewish parents had immigrated to Denmark from Russia at the start of the 20th century.  She fled Denmark in October 1943 along with her family as the country had come under Nazi occupation. She spent the rest of the war years in Sweden where she continued having great success with her career performing with orchestras and in cabarets and varieties. She returned to Denmark in 1945 and in the years that followed she became Denmark's leading female ballad singer.

name: Black Widow
comments: Rock band from Leicester. Formed in September 1969 and disbanded in 1973. Reformed from 2007 till 2014.

name: Buck Clayton
aliases: 25 Star Jazzmen in a Buck Clayton Jam Session
Buck Clayton and His All Stars
Buck Clayton with Buck Clayton's Orchestra

name: Kleiton & Kledir
comments: Duo of brothers singers and songwriters

name: Lobão
aliases: Lobão e Os Eremitas da Montanha
comments: Singer-songwriter, musician, publisher and TV personality

name: Dwight Adams
comments: American jazz trumpeter, based in Detroit, MI

name: Teresa Bright
comments: Hawaiian singer and ukulele player. Her music is also popular in Japan.

name: Zach Gill
comments: Indie folk/rock multi-instrumentalist and singer-songwriter. He is a member of Jack Johnson's Band since 2005.

name: Stan Urban
comments: Rock 'n' roll singer and pianist. Born in Dundee, Scotland, but has been living in Denmark since 1984.

name: Malcolm Yelvington
aliases: Malcolm Yelvington and Star Rhythm Boys

name: Hobo-Ekspressen
comments: One-off band founded for one single only.

name: Johnny Madsen
aliases: Johnny Madsen og Hal Bal Boys

name: Frank Aguiar
comments: Singer-songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, TV presenter, entrepreneur and politician

name: The Simon Sisters
comments: Duo of two sisters, Carly and Lucy Simon. After the duo recorded two albums for the Kapp label in 1964, Lucy left to marry and raise a family, while Carly went on to a successful solo career. They reunited in in 1969 for one album of children's music.

name: Eugene Field
comments: 19th century writer and poet from St. Louis, Missouri.

name: Carol Elliott
comments: Folk songwriter, singer, guitarist, also involved in producing and running an own label Heartstrong Records.

name: Siw Malmkvist
comments: Singer and actress popular in Scandinavia and West Germany, who had a #1 hit in West Germany in 1964 with "Liebeskummer lohnt sich nicht".

name: Billy Davidson
comments: Singer, songwriter and performer. Hails from the Florida Keys.

name: Simon Green
comments: Musical theatre performer. He played the part of Tony in the 1984 revival of the 1954 musical The Boy Friend .

name: Bonnie Hayes
aliases: Bonnie Hayes with The Wild Combo
comments: Singer-songwriter, musician and record producer from San Francisco, California

name: Skip Ewing
comments: Country music singer, songwriter and producer

name: Rusty Young
comments: Lap steel guitarist, singer and songwriter

name: Carol Fran
comments: Soul and blues singer, pianist and songwriter

name: Alvino Rey
aliases: Alvino Rey and His Orchestra – Vocal by The Blue Reys
Son of Ira Ironstrings accompanied by His Proud Pater and Their Free-Loading Relatives

name: Marshall Brown
comments: Brown was a multi-instrumentalist, who played trombone professionally.  His other career was as a teacher, and as a performer, he recorded almost exclusively as a sideman.

name: Ronnie Knull
comments: Rock and roll singer and multi-instrumentalist.

name: Dry Kill Logic
comments: Four-piece metal band from Westchester County, New York.

name: Vikingarna
comments: Originally started in 1958 as a skiffle group, the band underwent quite some line-up changes and turned into a Schlager/'dansband' and released their first LP in 1973. Most of their longplay releases are called "Kramgoa låtar" (= Good for cuddling tunes) + a number or year. In 2003, they finally announced their retirement.

name: Karen Damen
comments: Singer, actress, host and one of the original members of girl group K3. She acted in a few movies and hosted a few programs.

name: Christopher Malcolm
comments: Stage, television and film actor, later becoming a producer of theatrical plays and musicals.

name: George Whiting
comments: Composer. His best known song is "My Blue Heaven".  Vaudeville singer and performer, Whiting also wrote lyrics for popular songs.

name: Cornell Dupree
comments: R&B and soul jazz guitarist, who as a studio session guitarist recorded over 2500 sessions in his lifetime. One of his most known guitar riff's can be heard on the opening of Aretha Franklin's Respect .

name: Ruby Hill
comments: Actress and singer, born in Danville, Virginia. In 1953, she stated her career suffered from the “Lena Horne jinx” because she resembled (and was modeled after) Ms. Horne too closely.

name: Claude Boone
comments: Claude Boone was a singer, guitarist and songwriter from the Asheville area of North Carolina. In the 1930s he was a member of Cliff Carlisle band and recorded with him for Decca and Bluebird. For many years he performed with Carl Story.

name: Laura Ballance
comments: Bassist and co-founder of Merge Records .

name: Laura Cantrell
comments: Country music artist born in Nashville

name: Little Miss Cornshucks
aliases: Little Miss Cornshucks and Her All-Stars
comments: Vaudeville performer and singer. Her married name was Jordan.

name: Larry Elgart
aliases: Larry Elgart and His Manhattan Swing Orchestra
Larry Elgart And His New Hollywood Band
Larry Elgart and His New Hollywood Band

name: N.U. Unruh
comments: New York born percussionist and instrument inventor.

name: Mark Chung
comments: UK-born bassist and founder of the independent Freibank music publishing company, Chung also acted as Senior VP at Sony Music Entertainment in London from 1996 to 2005, before returning to Germany and relocating Freibank to Berlin. Between 2006 and 2012 he was also Chairman of VUT, the German association of independent music companies.

name: FM Einheit
comments: Industrial and electronic musician, composer and actor

name: Deutsch Amerikanische Freundschaft
comments: Electro NDW quartet formed in 1978. Later reduced to just the duo of Robert Görl and Gabi Delgado-Lopez.

name: Allison with One
comments: Industrial band based in Atlanta, Georgia

name: Bonfire Madigan
comments: "Baroque-folk punk" band led by cellist/vocalist/songwriter Madigan Shive.

name: Biddu
comments: British-Indian singer, songwriter, and producer, considered to be one of the pioneers of disco, Euro disco, and Indian pop

name: Aram Quartet
comments: Pop-rock music group Season 1 winner of the Italian edition of X Factor

name: Ilaria Porceddu
comments: Pop music singer Season 1 semi-finalist of the Italian edition of X Factor (5th place)

name: Cluster
comments: Jazz and pop a cappella quintet

name: Emanuele Dabbono
comments: Pop-rock music singer-songwriter Season 1 semi-finalist of the Italian edition of X Factor (3rd place)

name: Gino Scannapieco
comments: Pop-rock music singer Season 1 contestant of the Italian edition of X Factor (9th place)

name: Leo Z
comments: Music producer, arranger and composer currently based in Los Angeles.

name: Ray Ellis [jazz]
aliases: Ray Ellis and His Orchestra and Chorus
comments: Orchestra conductor, composer, arranger, record producer and saxophone player born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He was mostly associated with light jazz, pop and easy listening music but he also arranged for R&B performers including Etta James, Ben E. King, The Drifters and Brook Benton. He was A&R director for MGM and also worked with Barbra Streisand, Judy Garland, Anthony Newly and many other major performers.

name: Shifty Henry
comments: Musician, most noted as a double bass and bass guitar player, and blues songwriter. He also played flute, violin, viola, saxophone, and oboe and was in demand as a session musician and arranger in Los Angeles in the 1940s and 1950s.

name: Ken Elliott
comments: New Orleans radio DJ, known as 'Jack the Cat', artist manager, and songwriter

name: Lou Welsch
comments: Musician, label owner and lyricist from New Orleans

name: The Hawketts
comments: New Orleans R&B group comprised of teenage musicians

name: Guido Guglielminetti
comments: Bassist, guitarist, composer, arranger and record producer, born in Torino

name: Enrico Polito
comments: Pianist, singer, orchestra leader and composer

name: Squallor
comments: Satirical pop group, known for their crude and outrageous lyrics. Ironically, the members of the band were among the most respected and prolific "serious" pop musicians in Italy.

name: Erick Benzi
comments: Musician, songwriter, composer and record producer from Marseille

name: Ambra Marie
comments: Rock music singer Season 2 contestant of the Italian edition of X Factor (11th place)

name: Matteo Becucci
comments: Pop music singer Season 2 winner of the Italian edition of X Factor

name: Daniele Magro
comments: Pop music singer Season 2 semi-finalist of the Italian edition of X Factor (4th place)

name: Sisters of Soul
comments: Pop and R&B music group Season 2 contestants of the Italian edition of X Factor [12th place]

name: Enrico Nordio
comments: Pop music singer Season 2 contestant of the Italian edition of X Factor (7th place)

name: The Bastard Sons of Dioniso
comments: Rock music group Season 2 runner-up of the Italian edition of X Factor

name: Noemi [IT]
comments: Pop music singer Season 2 contestant of the Italian edition of X Factor (5th place)

name: Farias
comments: Pop-rock music group Season 2 contestants of the Italian edition of X Factor (8th place)

name: Serena Abrami
comments: Pop music singer Season 2 contestant of the Italian edition of X Factor (13th place)

name: Giacomo Salvietti
comments: Pop music singer Season 2 contestant of the Italian edition of X Factor (14th place)

name: Elisa Rossi
comments: Pop-rock music singer Season 2 contestant of the Italian edition of X Factor (15th place)

name: Andrea Gioacchini
comments: Pop music singer Season 2 contestant of the Italian edition of X Factor (10th place)

name: Erika Rose
comments: Musician, songwriter, businesswoman. She is Alicia Keys' manager.

name: Mike Bongiorno
comments: Radio and television presenter. Born in New York to Italian-American parents.

name: Dina Tosi
comments: Alberto Testa's wife. Sometimes Testa signed his songs with her name.

name: Ludovico Peregrini
comments: Television author. A familiar face for the audience in Italy, he is known as "Signor No" (Mr. No), the "arbitrator" in the quiz show Rischiatutto.

name: Richie Podolor
comments: Musician, record producer and songwriter. Best known as the producer of Three Dog Night . Owner of the legendary 'American Recording Co.' recording studio.

name: Dory Previn
comments: Folk singer, songwriter, lyricist and poet

name: Freddie Bell and The Bellboys
aliases: Freddie Bell and The Bell Boys

name: Jack Turner
comments: Country music performer from Haleyville, Alabama. Known as the "Singing River Boy".

name: Johnny "T" Talley
comments: Country & Rockabilly musician. The "T" stands for his home state Tennessee.

name: Sonny Parker
aliases: Sonny Parker and His All Stars
Sonny Parker With Lionel Hampton and His Orchestra
Sonny Parker With Lionel Hampton's Sextet

name: Tiny Grimes
aliases: Tiny Grimes and His Rockin' Highlanders
Tiny Grimes and His Rocking Highlanders
Tiny Grimes Swingtet featuring "Trummie" Young and John Hardee
comments: Jazz and R&B guitarist, notable for playing the tenor guitar, a four-stringed electric instrument.

name: Luke Jones
aliases: Luke Jones and His Five Joes'
comments: Musician (sax, clarinet) and bandleader born in Louisiana and raised in Los Angeles. He played with Lionel Hampton and Roy Milton. By the mid 1940s he formed his own groups and recorded with them.

name: Paul "Hucklebuck" Williams
comments: Blues and rhythm & blues saxophonist, bandleader and composer, who scored one of the first big hits of the R&B era with 'The Hucklebuck', an important precursor of rock 'n' roll.

name: Betty Hall Jones
comments: Boogie-woogie and swing pianist, singer, songwriter and arranger

name: Meade Lux Lewis
comments: Boogie-woogie jazz pianist.  Commencing in 1936, Lewis also began to play the celeste and may have been the first jazz pianist to play celeste.  He died in an automobile accident in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

name: Albert Ammons
aliases: Albert Ammons and His Rhythm Kings

name: Dickie Jones
comments: Actor. Best known as the voice of Pinocchio in the 1940 Walt Disney animated film Pinocchio .

name: Joel Shaw
comments: Pianist and bandleader born in Brooklyn, New York

name: Norman Cloutier
aliases: Norman Cloutier and His Merry Madcaps

name: Great Lake Swimmers
comments: Folk rock band founded in 2003 in Toronto, Ontario.

name: Kyle Riabko
comments: Singer, guitarist, songwriter, and actor who grew up in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan

name: The Sportsmen Quartet
comments: Originally billed as The Sportsmen, they became known as the Sportsmen Quartet after WWII. Appeared and/or sang in many movies in the 1940s. Joined the Jack Benny Show (radio and television) in September 1946 and appeared intermittently through 1963.  Performed voicework for Looney Tunes from 1938-1950. Tenor - Bill Day Second Tenor - Max Smith, replaced by Bob Stevens in 1949, replaced by Jay Mayer in 1951 Bass - Don Craig, quickly replaced by Thurl Ravenscroft, then Gurney Bell in 1949 Baritone - Art McCullogh, replaced by John Rarig, then Mart Sperzel in 1943, replaced by Jay Moffett in 1957 Note: Max Smith and Thurl Ravenscroft left in 1948 and formed The Mellomen

name: Oliver Wallace
comments: English-born composer and conductor.  Wallace had a long association with Disney Studios, writing scores and songs for Disney films.  His score for "Dumbo" won him an Academy Award, and he was nominated for the award on four other occasions.

name: Ilene Woods
comments: Singer-actress, best known for her role as the singing and speaking voice of "Cinderella" in the 1950 animated Disney film. She recorded only one solo album.

name: Hall Johnson
comments: Choir leader, composer; arranger and preservationist of traditional African American spirituals.

name: Johnny Messner
aliases: Johnny Messner and His Music Box Band
Johnny Messner and His Orchestra - Vocal Chorus by Johnny Messner and Ensemble

name: Charlie Spivak
aliases: Charlie Spivak, His Trumpet and His Orchestra
comments: Kiev, Ukraine-born big band trumpeter and bandleader. As a sideman in the bands of Tommy and Jimmy Dorsey, Jack Teagarden, Ray Noble, Bob Crosby and Ben Pollack, he built a formidable reputation as a lead trumpeter. Spivak, helped both artistically and financially by his mentor Glenn Miller, formed his own band featuring top-notch players, like Nelson Riddle, in 1940 and was quite successful.

name: The Jewels [US1]
comments: Los Angeles based R&B vocal group.

name: Verna Felton
comments: Stage, movie, radio and television actress, with many voice/voiceover roles including characters in several Disney animated movies.

name: Chris Gestrin
comments: Jazz pianist, composer, producer and sought-after session musician from Vancouver

name: Veda Hille
aliases: Veda Hille and Her Swell Band

name: No-Man
comments: Art-pop duo consisting of Tim Bowness and Steven Wilson, first named "No Man Is an Island (Except the Isle of Man)"

name: William Clarke
comments: Blues harmonica player, singer and songwriter

name: Lannie Garrett
aliases: Lannie Garrett & Her Swingin' Big Band
Lannie Garrett with The Gypsy Swing Revue
comments: Traditional pop/jazz-pop/country vocalist based in Denver, Colorado. In 2006, she opened her own nightclub Lannie's Clocktower Cabaret, and seems retired from recording since.

name: Mud Boy and The Neutrons
comments: Memphis soul blues collective: Lee Baker (guitar), Jim Dickinson (piano), Sid Selvidge (vocals), Jim Crosthwait.

name: Borderline [US]
comments: Rock band also featuring Bruce Brookshire, Daniel Bud Ford, Danny Lastinger, Micky Moody and singer Georg Bayer.

name: The Dixie Flyers [US]
comments: Session group based at Atlantic Records' Criteria Recording Studio in Miami

name: Lee Moses
comments: R&B and soul singer and guitarist.

name: The Glories
comments: Vocal soul trio from New York City

name: Moving Hearts
comments: Celtic rock band formed in 1981, which split up in 1985.

name: Glen Ricks
comments: Soul and reggae singer-songwriter and producer.

name: Joanna Connor
comments: Blues rock slide guitarist, singer and songwriter

name: Gary Stewart
comments: Country and honky-tonk guitarist, pianist, singer and songwriter. Stewart died from a self-inflicted gunwound, despondent over the death of his wife less than a month earlier.

name: Betty Joplin
comments: Jazz and traditional pop singer born in Jackson, Michigan and based in Lansing, Michigan.

name: Harpo Marx
comments: Actor and comedian best known as a member of the Marx Brothers. He was also a self-taught harpist.

name: Menster Phip
comments: DIY/garage band from Fairlawn, New Jersey.

name: The Lost Fingers
comments: Gypsy jazz music group formed in Quebec City

name: Henrik Jensen
comments: Filter Section is one of his electro projects.

name: Millenium
comments: Melodic heavy metal band from Tampa, Florida

name: Tarwater
comments: Experimental low-fi duo also active as soundtrack and soundscape musicians/composers

name: The Three Chuckles
comments: The Three Chuckles were a vocal/instrumental trio from Brooklyn, New York. The original members were Tommy Romano (Vocal,Guitar),Tommy"Russ" Gilberto (Lead Vocals and Bass) and Phil Benti (Vocal,Accordion). In 1953 Teddy Randazzo replaced Phil Benti and became the lead singer of this group.

name: Mark Shreeve
comments: Songwriter, musician and electronic music composer.

name: The Snakes [US]
comments: Members: Glenn Worf James Stroud Kenny Greenberg Wally Wilson Mike Henderson

name: Tonic Sol-fa
comments: A cappella trio from the Minneapolis–Saint Paul region

name: Bald Rapunzel
comments: Band from the Washington DC Area.

name: Cuff the Duke
comments: Alt-country band band from Oshawa, Ontario. Formed in 2001.

name: George Canyon

name: Rino Gaetano
comments: Singer-songwriter, known for his raspy voice and his lyrics blending nonsense and social satire. Gaetano scored a string of hits in the 1970's but, after his tragic death in a car accident, his works fell into oblivion. Recently, he has been rediscovered by a younger generation of Italian fans and artists.

name: Victoria Spivey

comments: Classic blues singer with a 40-year career in music. In 1961, she was the co-founder of Spivey Records , which was a budget label specializing in blues.

comments: Tenor saxophone player, swamp pop singer and songwriter

name: Alice Babs
aliases: Alice Babs med sin dotter Lilleba
comments: Singer and actress from Kalmar. Her first recording was the song "Joddlarflickan" on 25 April 25 1939. She formed the jazz trio "The Swe-Danes" in 1958. The same year she was the first Swedish contender in Eurovision Song Contest and finished fourth. In 1972 she was appointed court singer and 1974 she became a member of the Royal Academy of Music.

name: Knox Chandler

comments: Texas country music singer and songwriter

name: Richard Fagan

comments: Country music singer-songwriter, author and TV host

name: Gillian Gilbert
comments: Guitarist, keyboardist and singer.  Gilbert was asked to join New Order within months of its formation.  After the birth of her children, Gilbert stopped touring with New Order in 1998, and completely left the band in 2001; however, she rejoined in 2011.

name: Peter Hook
comments: Multi-instrumentalist who most often is heard on electric bass.  Hook also sings and writes songs.  Hook has not played with New Order since 2007 and has a difficult relationship with the rest of the band.

name: Stephen Morris
comments: Primarily a drummer and percussionist, Morris also plays keyboards.

name: Jody Reynolds
comments: Rock 'n' roll singer, guitarist and songwriter

name: Don Everly
comments: Close harmony singer, guitarist and songwriter

name: Jack Clement
comments: Record producer, songwriter, singer and musician. Most famous for his work at Sun . He was inducted into the Country Music Hall of Fame in 2013.

name: Charles Underwood
comments: Songwriter, musician, producer, publisher, and engineer

name: Harry Carroll
comments: Pianist and songwriter from Atlantic City, New Jersey.  Carroll was the director of ASCAP from 1914 to 1917. Inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1970

name: Joseph McCarthy
comments: McCarthy started in his career in music as a singer in Boston, but move to New York, working on the Staff of a Tin Pan Alley music publisher.  He was a charter member of ASCAP and on its Board of Directors from 1921 through 1929.  McCarthy was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame in 1970.

name: Sandy Denny

name: Jean Constantin
aliases: Jean Constantin - Orchestre dir. : Big César

name: Francis Rossi

name: Reginald Ashby
comments: Pianist, arranger and songwriter. He played with Charlie Singleton in the late 1940s and Pete Brown in the early 1950s. He was a close friend of Doc Pomus who shared songwriter credit for "Boogie Woogie Country Girl" with him.

name: Fred McDowell
aliases: Fred McDowell with The Hunter's Chapel Singers
comments: Country blues singer, guitarist, and songwriter, who recorded mostly during the 1960s

name: Alex Atkins
comments: Saxophone player and songwriter. Atkins played with Memphis Slim.

name: Jon Hendricks
comments: Jazz singer, lyricist and one of the originators of vocalese

name: Casey Anderson [US2]

comments: Keyboarder also playing accordion, saxophones and other horns

name: Mike Campbell [US1]

name: Bon Scott
comments: Rock vocalist, best known as the lead singer and lyricist of AC/DC from 1974 until his death in 1980. He was born in Kirriemuir, Scotland, and emigrated to Australia with his family in 1952 at the age of six. The family initially settled in Melbourne, but moved to Fremantle, where Bon joined his first band, The Spektors, in 1964 as drummer and occasional lead vocalist. He performed in several other bands before replacing Dave Evans as the lead singer of AC/DC in 1974.

name: Angus Young
comments: Guitarist and songwriter, born in Glasgow, Scotland. Best known as the co-founder, lead guitarist, songwriter and sole constant member of the Australian hard rock band AC/DC.

name: Glen Matlock
comments: Best known as the original bassist of the Sex Pistols, Matlock also plays guitar and sings.  Matlock has been a member of several bands since leaving the Sex Pistols and has also participated in several Sex Pistols reunion tours.

name: Willie Chambers
comments: Blues and soul guitarist, originally from Lee County, Mississippi.

name: Joseph Chambers
comments: Blues, gospel and soul singer and guitarist

name: John Madara
comments: Singer, songwriter and producer from Philadelphia

name: Mike Leander
comments: Arranger, songwriter and record producer; co-founder of RAM (Rock Artist Management)

comments: Singer, songwriter, record producer and occasionally actor
